body_html: @vincentvanhoucke I guess @skearnes meaning compressing the training data instead of the checkpoints. In some cases, the input feature vectors are extremely sparse and compression will reduce the IO dramatically. So I'm also wondering whether the compression of TFRecord file will be supported in the future?
